caption.p: Major volatile components (>5%) in different Curcuma spp.

tr.td: Curzerenone (24.6%), 1,8-cineole (11.0%), camphor (10.6%), zedoarol (6.3%), isocurcumenol (5.8%), curcumenol (5.6%), and furanogermenone (5.5%)
Camphor (29.4%), germacrone (21.2%), borneol (7.3%), and germacrene B (5.2%)

Methenolone (16.6%), 8,9-dehydro-9-formyl-cycloisolongifolene (15.9%), labd-13-en-15-oic acid,8,12-epoxy-12-hydroxy-γ-lactone (10.8%), propiolic acid, 3-(1-hydroxy)-2 isopropyl-1,5-methylcyclohexyl) (7.8%), and 4-oxo-β-isodamascol (5.2%)
Dehydrocurdione (27.6%), curcumenol (15.1%), germacrone (10.2%), and gajutsulactone A (6.3%)
1,8-Cineole (17.7%), curzerenone (10.5%), furanogermenone (7.8%), camphor (7.5%), ( Z)-3-hexenol (5.8%), and furanodienone (5.1%)
( Z)-β-Farnesene (21.9%), guaia-6,9-diene (19.8%), α-longipinene (14.8%), α-guaiene (14.5%), and camphor (5.5%).
Xanthorrhizol isomer (12.7%), methyleugenol (10.5%), and palmitic acid (5.2%)

8,9-Dehydro-9-formyl-cycloisolongifolene (2.7–36.8%), germacrone (4.3–16.5%), ar-turmerone (2.5–17.7%), turmerone (2.6–18.4%), ermanthin (0.8–13.3%), β-sesquiphellandrene (0.3–11.3%), and ar-curcumene (0.3–10.5%).

Camphor (26.3%), borneol (16.5%), vinyldimethylcarbinol (12.2%), caryophyllene oxide (6.3%), cubenol (5.6%), and cucumber alcohol (5.2%)

1,8-cineole (15.3%), camphor (10.1%), germacrone (6.9%), β-elemene (6.3%), curzerene (6.7%), and β-elemenone (5.2%)

Curdione (27.0%) and an unidentified oxygenated sesquiterpene (12.3%)

fn.p: HD = hydrodistillation; SD = steam distillation; SE = solvent extract; MTBE = methyl tert-butyl ether; SFE = supercritical fluid extraction; SPME = solid-phase microextraction; HSME = headspace solvent microextraction; PLE = pressurized liquid extraction.
